name: Kiama Blue Hotel & Apartments

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from an overnight stay at Kiama Blue. We are accor members so we used it as one of our free nights then upgraded to a superior room for an extra $20.
reviews.title: Great Location!

likes.liked: — Fresh, new and modern. Friendly staff!

reviews.title: Great relaxation spot.....
reviews.text: The complex is brand new so very fresh and modern. The room was very large with lovely new decor. The room also had a great little mini kitchenette at the end that we didn't use but would be handy for longer stays, especially if you had children (we left ours at home with nanna!). The bed was a massive king size but quite uncomfortable as it joined together with a seam down the middle, obviously so it can be pulled apart to make up other bed configurations, not nice to sleep on. The old CRT TV looked very out of place in this otherwise stylish room.

The brasserie was lovely to sit outside and overlook the harbour with a drink or two... It also had a very nice breakfast. We arrived just after a large group had left and the staff apologised and replenished the whole breakfast buffet within 5 mins.
reviews.title: New and trying hard

likes.disliked: — Hard to find due to no sign, some teething problems still

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a lovely hotel, despite the bed. I would recommend going to Chachis for dinner, a lovely LITTLE Italian restaurant in one of the Kiama terrace houses- yum! I would also plan a trip around the Kiama markets, very worthwhile.
reviews.title: Nice- but some problems

reviews.text: My husband and went on a packagae deal as advertised by the tv show Getaway. I had read the reveiws and was a tad concerned, were my expectations too high? We arrived on the 18/7 and stayed til the morning of the 20/7.
reviews.title: Nice place, but coulda been a contender

likes.disliked: — Lack of health facilities, limited dining options in the restaurant.

description: Kiama Blue overlooks beautiful Kiama Harbour and the Pacific Ocean. Ideal for a weekend getaway, the resort is located within a short walking distance to the famous Kiama Blowhole, historic terrace shops and the beach. Acommodation at Kiama Blue ranges from Standard Rooms through to Deluxe Rooms and self-contained Apartments, all featuring ensuite bathrooms, mini bars and tea and coffee making facilities.
